articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's armed forces have begun evacuating Palestinian civilians from Rafah ahead of a threatened assault on the southern Gazan city, an Israeli broadcaster said on Monday.
articles.title: Israel military begins evacuating Palestinian civilians from Rafah, radio says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamist group Hamas on Sunday claimed responsibility for an attack on the Kerem Shalom crossing between Israel and Gaza that local media reports said resulted in Israeli casuatlies.
articles.title: Hamas claims responsibility for attack on Israel-Gaza border crossing, casualties reported

articles.author: Raul Cortes, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Mexican authorities on Sunday confirmed the American and two Australian tourists who went missing in northern Mexico last week are dead after their bodies were identified by parents.
articles.title: Parents identify bodies of U.S., Australian tourists missing in Mexico

articles.author: Valentine Hilaire, Elida Moreno
articles.description: Panama's former security minister Jose Raul Mulino on Sunday stormed to victory in a presidential poll dominated by his old boss, the corruption tainted ex-leader Ricardo Martinelli, who buttressed his campaign while holed up in Nicaragua's embassy.
articles.title: Mulino wins Panama presidency with support from convicted former leader

articles.author: Mikhail Flores
articles.description: U.S. and Philippine armed forces fired missiles and artillery to thwart a simulated invasion in the Philippines' northern waters facing Taiwan on Monday, in a show of military force and strengthening ties as regional tensions rise.
articles.title: Philippines, US repel mock foreign invaders in annual military exercises

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Monday the country will not use water cannons or any offensive weapons in the South China Sea.
articles.title: Philippines says won't raise South China Sea tensions, won't use water cannons

articles.author: Jessie Pang, Joyce Zhou
articles.description: Cost-conscious Chinese tourists have replaced many of the cash-rich mainland travellers who once flocked to Hong Kong, with some only interested in free walking tours of the city and staying across the border in Shenzhen overnight to save money.
articles.title: Low-budget Chinese travellers highlight shift in Hong Kong tourism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesia has proposed to cut its share of payments for a joint fighter jet development project with South Korea to about one-third of the originally agreed amount, South Korean news agency Yonhap reported on Monday.
articles.title: Indonesia proposes cutting payments for S.Korea fighter jet project, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Mahamat Ramadane, Portia Crowe
articles.description: Chadians go to the polls on Monday three years after their military leader seized power, in the first presidential election in Africa's Sahel region since a wave of coups.
articles.title: Chad votes in first Sahel presidential poll since wave of coups

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from heavy rains that have inundated Brazil's southern state of Rio Grande do Sul has risen to at least 66, local authorities said on Sunday.
articles.title: Death toll from rains in southern Brazil climbs to 66, over 100 still missing
